reviews.review_text:
This place has pretty aesthetic vibes with lots of goan specialties! I also liked the wide varieties of options for coffee thatâ€™s made from African beans! If you are coffee lover like me then this is the place to be.
Overall great food but what I find lacking was their attentive service. Place was pretty crowded for a weekend and I felt the staffs were a bit overwhelmed!

Very good food. Tried quite a few items, except for Chirozo, none of them disappointed. The Mocha Latte and Hot chocolate were worth trying. Pancakes were very soft. Also try the Pesto chicken sandwich and the bacon.
Found the service a bit rude though.

I have visited caravela once to many times but have not got an opportunity to write a review on them so here we are. The ambience of the whole restaurant is quite chill as there are usually not many people (or maybe I was lucky) and had hilarious posters plastered on every wall. Service was pretty good, and we got our food within 20 minutes. The food itself was quite heavy and I feel you would have to order only 2 dishes to feel full. First we got served the Omelette with chicken pieces infused which is actually quite ingenious and a hearty breakfast. The hot chocolate was quite average as I have had better but I like the fact that they serve it with Marshmallows. We then had the pain au Chocolat which oozed with chocolate and also was quite crunchy. Last was a vegan cheesecake I think which contained of a berry preserve which I felt just tasted like dense bread. Overall, I loved this place before and i still do now. I highly reccomend it.
